## About Me

I am an assistant professor of biostatistics in the [Department of Public Health Sciences](https://health.ucdavis.edu/phs/divisions/biostats/index.html "UC Davis Public Health Sciences: Division of Biostatistics") at [UC Davis](https://www.ucdavis.edu/ "UC Davis"). I have worked on a variety of applied and theoretical statistical challenges, including problems in causal inference, data fusion, and infectious disease surveillance.

## Education

**PhD in Biostatistics** | University of California, Los Angeles | 2021

**MS in Statistics** | Stanford University | 2010

**BS in Symbolic Systems** | Stanford University | 2009

## Research Interests

- Causal Inference
- Data Fusion
- Agent-Based Models
- Infectious Disease Epidemiology
